channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Lots of gasps and dropped jaws’: Stephen Colbert learned of Jimmy Kimmel’s suspension while taping his own canceled CBS show
item.description: President Trump called it “Great News for America: The ratings challenged Jimmy Kimmel Show is CANCELLED." (The show was suspended, not cancelled.)

item.title: Disgruntled Starbucks workers in 3 states sue over dress-code changes, saying the company refused to reimburse them
item.description: “As part of this change, and to ensure out partners were prepared, partners received two shirts at no cost,” Starbucks said about its workers.

item.title: FCC chief considers charging Kimmel, ABC with spreading misinformation over jokes, remarks about the ideology of Charlie Kirk assassin
item.description: “We’re reinvigorating the FCC’s enforcement of the public interest,” Brendan Carr said on CNBC, “and I think that’s a good thing.”

item.title: The 10 best countries to retire in right now—and America didn’t make the cut
item.description: As retiring in America becomes increasingly unaffordable, retirees are booking a one-way trip to Portugal instead.

item.title: Kennedy Announces Firing of Organ Transplant Group After Safety Problems
item.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. announced the firing of one of the groups that arrange U.S. organ donations, effectively closing it down — and sending a warning...

item.title: $34 billion was wiped from Larry Ellison’s net worth days after briefly becoming the world’s richest as ‘AI bubble’ fears grow
item.description: Larry Ellison briefly knocked Tesla CEO Elon Musk from the top spot last week, but he’s lost billions in the one week since.

item.title: Tiffany Trump’s Family Cruised the Mediterranean on an Oil Mogul's Yacht
item.description: The vacation, amid diplomatic talks on oil industry expansion, is a measure of how hard it is to tell where the interests of government end and those ...

item.title: E.P.A. Keeps Polluters on the Hook to Clean Up ‘Forever Chemicals’
item.description: The decision came despite an effort by a former industry lawyer who is now at the E.P.A. to reverse the regulation.

item.title: E.P.A. Keeps Polluters on the Hook to Clean Up ‘Forever Chemicals’
item.description: The decision came despite an effort by a former industry lawyer who is now at the E.P.A. to reverse the regulation.

item.title: I’ve Written About Loads of Scams. This Phone Scam Almost Got Me.
item.description: The caller ID said “Chase Bank,” and the man on the line said I might be a victim of fraud. His supervisor would explain.

item.title: Live Updates: Trump and Starmer Acknowledge Divide Over Palestinian Statehood
item.description: President Trump and Prime Minister Keir Starmer discussed the wars in Gaza and Ukraine during Mr. Trump’s state visit. Earlier, the two leaders signed...

item.title: Democratic Senators Call for U.S. Recognition of Palestinian State
item.description: The resolution has little chance of advancing in the Republican-controlled Senate, given growing G.O.P. opposition to a two-state solution in the Isra...

item.title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Allow Removal of Fed Governor
item.description: President Trump had pressed to fire Lisa Cook before the central bank’s meeting, at which the board voted to raise interest rates.

item.title: Wildfire Smoke Will Kill Thousands More by 2050, Study Finds
item.description: Pollution from fires, intensified by rising temperatures, is on track to become one of America’s deadliest climate disasters.
